page.title: 13Baddesley Clinton Manor
page.content:
A medieval moated manor house once owned by the Broome family.They later became Ferrers with the marriage of Constance Broome to Edward Ferrers.
The house was given to the National Trust and opened to the public in 1983.
It has 40 thousand visitors a year but only 50 can go in at a time, because the floors are not very safe.
There is a blood stain on the library floor from a priest killed by Nickolas in 1480.He was caught chatting up his wife.
The garden is best in Spring,When the bulbs are in bloom.
